http://schema.org/minValue.description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

http://schema.org/description.description: A short description of the item.

http://schema.org/valueName.description: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

http://schema.org/potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

http://schema.org/mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details. Inverse property: mainEntity.

http://schema.org/sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

http://schema.org/valuePattern.description: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

http://schema.org/valueMaxLength.description: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

http://schema.org/multipleValues.description: Whether multiple values are allowed for the property. Default is false.

http://schema.org/defaultValue.description: The default value of the input. For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

http://schema.org/readonlyValue.description: Whether or not a property is mutable. Default is false. Specifying this for a property that also has a value makes it act similar to a "hidden" input in an HTML form.

http://schema.org/image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

http://schema.org/stepValue.description: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

http://schema.org/maxValue.description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

http://schema.org/valueRequired.description: Whether the property must be filled in to complete the action. Default is false.

http://schema.org/additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

http://schema.org/valueMinLength.description: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

http://schema.org/image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

http://schema.org/description.description: A short description of the item.

http://schema.org/potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

http://schema.org/mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details. Inverse property: mainEntity.

http://schema.org/additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

http://schema.org/sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
